alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Carroll; Clay; Clinton; Daviess; De Kalb; Jackson; Lafayette; Livingston; Ray (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:29AM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Daviess, eastern Clinton, Clay, Ray, western Carroll, Caldwell, central Lafayette, southeastern DeKalb, northern Jackson and southwestern Livingston Counties through 315 AM CDT... At 228 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Cameron to near Polo to Liberty. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Kansas City, Independence, Liberty, Excelsior Springs, Cameron, Chillicothe, Kearney, Richmond, Lexington, North Kansas City, Carrollton, Sugar Creek, Buckner, Lawson, Lathrop, Hamilton, Claycomo, Courtney, Pleasant Valley and Braymer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 in Missouri between mile markers 10 and 58. Interstate 435 between mile markers 50 and 57. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Caldwell; Carroll; Clay; Clinton; Daviess; De Kalb; Jackson; Lafayette; Livingston; Ray
